text: Jaan Tomp (13 May 1882 – 1943) was an Estonian journalist. He was born in Uue- Võidu vald, Viljandi County. From 1905–1908 he worked for Kodumaa, followed by Kodumaa Hääl, Maa, Meie Kodu and Meie Kodumaa. In 1919-1920 he was chairman of the Estonian Journalists' Union, and was an honorary member from 1934. From 1918 until 1937 he was an editor of Vaba Maa. ==References== Category:1882 births Category:1943 deaths Category:People from Viljandi County Category:People from the Governorate of Livonia Category:Estonian journalists Category:Estonian non-fiction writers Category:20th-century Estonian writers Category:Estonian male writers Category:20th-century journalists
title: Jaan Tomp (journalist)
